title: Lessons from the Rally in European Energy Prices
description: Energy prices in Europe have risen sharply over the past few months. For some, higher prices are a reason to accelerate the energy transition; others see it as a caution against a transition that is too rapid.

title: Revisiting U.S. Policy in Myanmar
description: Burma’s political impasse and intensifying civil war indicate that U.S. policy toward Burma has been ineffective in the seven months since the military coup. Washington should revisit this policy and develop a strategy consistent with the political and military realities.

title: The Sustainable Development Goals: A Playbook for Reengagement
description: Great power politics has come for international development and its prevailing framework: the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

title: The Evening: Boosters, Government Shutdown, Infidels, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Boosters, Government Shutdown, Infidels, and More.

title: Examining Extremism: Harakat al Shabaab al Mujahideen (al Shabaab)
description: The Transnational Threats Project’s Examining Extremism series provides an overview and assessment of al Shabaab—an Islamist insurgent group that has waged a protracted insurgency in Somalia and launched attacks on regional states in East Africa.

title: The Secret Behind the French Interest in Iraq: A Geostrategic Analysis
description: France must realize Iraq's geostrategic significance and play a stabilizing role against terrorism and outside competition in the region, writes an Affiliate of CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.

title: Where Does Russian Discontent Go from Here? Russia’s 2021 Election Considered
description: Russia’s ruling party retained its supermajority in the State Duma after a falsified election that offered no real alternative to the status quo. How will discontented citizens respond?

title: Why African Governments Are Accepting Afghan Refugees
description: Why are African states accepting Afghan refugees? Judd Devermont and Erol Yayboke share implications behind governments' moral and geopolitical considerations and provide recommendations for U.S. government response.

title: High-Tech Hajj
description: Pilgrims have been visiting Mecca since before the advent of Islam. The centuries-old tradition looked considerably different this year, and for more than one reason.

title: The Evening: Covid Summit, Terror Groups Rebuild, Blind Willie McTell and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Covid Summit, Terror Groups Rebuild, Blind Willie McTell and More

title: China Headaches for Iran Deal
description: Jon Alterman gives a commentary on China’s changing role in nuclear negotiations.

title: Reaching Farther, Risking Less
description: Remotely crewed systems play an important role for ISR in contested spaces. This brief examines DoD's investment, comparing budget and strategy. The Air Force led early in remotely crewed systems, but has reduced its investment while spending on maritime systems increased.
